name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Step 1: Boil potatoes and peas until they’re as soft as your post-exam brain.
Step 2: Chop onions, tomatoes, and capsicum finely — or emotionally, up to you.
Step 3: Heat a giant spoon of butter in a pan and sauté the veggies like you're hosting a food vlog.
Step 4: Add bhaji masala, salt, and mash it all together like you’re erasing stress.
Step 5: Simmer with a splash of water till it becomes street-style magic.
Step 6: Toast pav with way too much butter (there's no such thing, really).
Step 7: Serve with onions, lemon, and confidence. You just made heaven on a plate.

name: Maggi Masala
instructions: Step 1: Boil 1.5 cups of water like you’re on a 2-minute mission.
Step 2: Toss in chopped carrots and peas — adulting points unlocked.
Step 3: Add the noodles and that iconic Maggi masala packet.
Step 4: Stir, stare, and don’t leave the stove (betrayal happens fast).
Step 5: Cook till noodles soak up flavor. Optional: add cheese and become a legend.
Step 6: Serve hot and enjoy while judging the 2-minute cooking myth.

name: Rajma Chawal
instructions: Step 1: Soak rajma overnight — or at least till it feels like commitment.
Step 2: Pressure cook it till soft, not mushy. You want emotion, not tears.
Step 3: Sauté onion, ginger, garlic, and tomatoes in oil till they unite like a power couple.
Step 4: Add spices, then rajma. Simmer till thick and dramatic.
Step 5: Boil rice separately. Keep it fluffy, not clingy.
Step 6: Serve rajma over rice like it’s royalty. Prepare for food coma.

name: Paneer Bhurji
instructions: Step 1: Crumble paneer like you're shredding your regrets.
Step 2: Sauté onions and green chilies till they’re golden and mildly dangerous.
Step 3: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they surrender.
Step 4: Add spices, then toss in the paneer. Stir like you mean it.
Step 5: Cook for 5 mins. Serve with toast, paratha, or solo confidence.

name: Dal Tadka
instructions: Step 1: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until it's soft and squishy (like your feelings).
Step 2: In another pan, heat ghee. Add cumin and let it crackle like a gossip session.
Step 3: Toss in chopped garlic, then onion. Sauté till golden and glorious.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook till mushy. Spice it with salt, chili, and drama.
Step 5: Pour the tadka into the dal. Stir gently like it’s a love story.
Step 6: Simmer for 5 mins and serve with rice or roti. Optional: top with ghee and gratitude.

name: Chole Bhature
instructions: Step 1: Soak chickpeas overnight — this is non-negotiable prep.
Step 2: Pressure cook chickpeas till they're soft but not offended.
Step 3: Make a rich gravy with sautéed onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and a riot of spices.
Step 4: Let the chickpeas soak in the masala drama and simmer.
Step 5: Make dough with maida, let it rest like a lazy Sunday.
Step 6: Roll into bhature, deep fry till they puff like your ego when it works.
Step 7: Plate them together and prepare for worship.

name: Khichdi
instructions: Step 1: Rinse rice and dal like you’re washing off bad vibes.
Step 2: Add chopped veggies if you want to pretend it’s healthy.
Step 3: Toss it all in a pressure cooker with salt, turmeric, and water.
Step 4: Pressure cook till everything blends like a nostalgic lullaby.
Step 5: Add a spoonful of ghee and stir like you care.
Step 6: Serve hot with papad or pickle and call it soul food.

name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Step 1: Blanch spinach, then blend it into smooth green silk.
Step 2: Sauté onions and garlic until golden and fragrant.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook till they collapse into sauciness.
Step 4: Mix in the spinach puree, add spices, stir gently.
Step 5: Add paneer cubes like plot twists. Simmer.
Step 6: Serve hot with naan or rice and deep personal satisfaction.

name: Lemon Rice
instructions: Step 1: Cook rice and let it cool — clingy rice is not cool.
Step 2: Heat oil, crackle mustard seeds, toss in curry leaves and chilies.
Step 3: Add turmeric and salt — make it golden.
Step 4: Mix in the rice and stir like a pro.
Step 5: Squeeze fresh lemon juice generously.
Step 6: Serve with chutney or alone like a boss.

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Step 1: Chop potato and gobi into bite-sized confidence.
Step 2: Sauté onions and tomatoes until they merge like BFFs.
Step 3: Add spices and then the veggies. Stir with love.
Step 4: Cover and cook till tender but not a mushy betrayal.
Step 5: Garnish with coriander and serve with roti or nostalgia.

name: Chicken Biryani
instructions: Step 1: Marinate chicken in yogurt, spices, and mint for at least an hour — longer if you're patient.
Step 2: Fry onions until golden and crispy like caramelized dreams.
Step 3: Partially cook basmati rice with whole spices and set aside.
Step 4: Cook the marinated chicken in a pot till almost done.
Step 5: Layer the rice over chicken, sprinkle fried onions, mint, and ghee.
Step 6: Cover and cook on low (dum) for 20 minutes. Don't peek!
Step 7: Fluff gently and serve like royalty. Accept compliments humbly (or not).

name: Jeera Rice
instructions: Step 1: Cook rice separately till fluffy but not mushy.
Step 2: Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them sizzle with excitement.
Step 3: Toss in the cooked rice, add salt to taste, and stir gently.
Step 4: Serve with dal, curry, or as-is with zero guilt.

name: Matar Paneer
instructions: Step 1: Sauté onions till golden, then add tomatoes and cook into a smooth base.
Step 2: Blend the mixture for a silky gravy or keep it chunky for rustic vibes.
Step 3: Add peas and cook till they're soft but sassy.
Step 4: Add paneer cubes and simmer in the gravy for 5–10 mins.
Step 5: Serve hot with roti, naan, or your soulmate.

name: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Step 1: Slash chicken pieces and marinate with yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, and tandoori masala.
Step 2: Let it sit for hours — overnight if you're loyal.
Step 3: Grill or bake till the outside is charred and the inside is juicy.
Step 4: Serve with mint chutney and a side of swagger.

name: Bhindi Masala
instructions: Step 1: Wash and dry bhindi thoroughly. Slime is a crime.
Step 2: Chop bhindi, onion, and tomatoes like you mean business.
Step 3: Sauté onions and bhindi in oil until crisp, not clingy.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and spices. Cook till flavors fall in love.
Step 5: Serve hot with phulka or solo for bhindi fans only.

name: Mixed Vegetable Curry
instructions: Step 1: Chop all vegetables into small, equal-sized responsibility cubes.
Step 2: Heat oil and sauté onions until they’re golden and slightly crispy.
Step 3: Add all the vegetables and stir them into a colorful chaos.
Step 4: Add your favorite spices, cover with a lid, and let it cook slowly.
Step 5: Stir occasionally and cook until everything is soft and well-behaved.
Step 6: Serve hot with roti, rice, or applause.

name: Egg Curry
instructions: Step 1: Boil eggs and peel them like you’re revealing hidden treasure.
Step 2: Sauté chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until golden and aromatic.
Step 3: Add chopped tomatoes and spices. Cook until it becomes a rich, thick gravy.
Step 4: Gently drop in the eggs and let them soak in the spicy luxury.
Step 5: Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with coriander and serve with rice or paratha.

name: Kadhi Pakora
instructions: Step 1: Make a smooth batter with besan and curd — no lumps, no drama.
Step 2: Add spices and water to form kadhi consistency. Set aside.
Step 3: Mix besan, chopped onions, and spices for pakora batter.
Step 4: Deep fry spoonfuls of the batter till crispy and irresistible.
Step 5: Simmer the kadhi, then drop the pakoras in like VIP guests.
Step 6: Cook for 10 minutes and serve with steamed rice and smiles.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Step 1: Marinate chicken in yogurt, chili, garlic, and lemon. Let it rest like royalty.
Step 2: Cook the chicken till slightly charred and smoky.
Step 3: Blend tomatoes into a silky base and cook with butter and cream.
Step 4: Add the cooked chicken, let it simmer till the gravy hugs it tight.
Step 5: Serve with naan, rice, or straight from the pot with a spoon.

name: Curd Rice
instructions: Step 1: Cook and cool the rice — this dish doesn’t like heat.
Step 2: Mix rice with fresh curd until creamy and smooth.
Step 3: Heat oil and crackle mustard seeds, curry leaves, ginger, and chili.
Step 4: Pour the tempering over the rice and mix like a lullaby.
Step 5: Chill or serve at room temp. Pairs best with hot weather and peace.

name: Samosa
instructions: Step 1: Knead maida into a firm dough and let it rest — like a drama queen.
Step 2: Boil and mash potatoes, mix in peas and spices till tasty chaos.
Step 3: Roll the dough, cut into halves, and shape into cones.
Step 4: Fill with spicy potato mix and seal like a delicious secret.
Step 5: Deep fry till golden and crispy. Serve hot with chutney and judgment.

name: Batata Vada
instructions: Step 1: Boil and mash potatoes with mustard seeds, green chili, and spices.
Step 2: Make round balls and dip in thick besan batter.
Step 3: Heat oil and deep fry the vadas till golden brown.
Step 4: Serve with pav and chutney or enjoy solo like a spicy snack star.

name: Dhokla
instructions: Step 1: Mix besan, lemon juice, water, and a pinch of ENO. Stir like a wizard.
Step 2: Pour into greased plate and steam for 15–20 minutes.
Step 3: Heat oil, crackle mustard seeds and green chili for the tempering.
Step 4: Pour tempering over the dhokla and cut into squares.
Step 5: Serve fluffy and warm with green chutney.

name: Masala Corn
instructions: Step 1: Boil or steam corn kernels until soft.
Step 2: Mix with melted butter, lemon juice, and masala of your choice.
Step 3: Stir well and serve in a cup like street-side comfort food.

name: Sev Puri
instructions: Step 1: Place crispy puris on a plate like edible bowls.
Step 2: Fill with mashed potato, chopped onion, and chutneys.
Step 3: Top with sev and sprinkle chaat masala.
Step 4: Serve immediately before it turns into soggy tragedy.

name: Stuffed Capsicum
instructions: Step 1: Cut tops off capsicums and scoop out seeds like you're hiding treasure.
Step 2: Stuff with mashed potato, onion, spices, and cheese.
Step 3: Bake or shallow fry till capsicums soften and cheese melts.
Step 4: Serve hot with roti or rice and applause.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Step 1: Knead soft dough using wheat flour and water.
Step 2: Boil and mash potatoes with spices and green chilies.
Step 3: Roll dough balls, stuff with potato mix, and seal.
Step 4: Flatten and roast on tawa with ghee until golden.
Step 5: Serve with curd, pickle, and ego boost.

name: Curd Rice
instructions: Step 1: Cook and cool rice — no one likes hot curd.
Step 2: Mix rice with fresh curd until creamy.
Step 3: Temper mustard seeds, ginger, and chili in oil.
Step 4: Pour over curd rice and stir with love.
Step 5: Serve chilled or room temp — zen in a bowl.

name: Litti Chokha
instructions: Step 1: Knead dough and prepare sattu filling with mustard oil and spices.
Step 2: Shape and stuff the littis, then bake or roast them.
Step 3: For chokha, roast brinjal, tomato, and potato, then mash with spices.
Step 4: Serve litti with chokha and a spoonful of ghee on top.

name: Vegetable Korma
instructions: Step 1: Boil veggies till they're polite but firm.
Step 2: Grind cashews with onion and tomato to a creamy paste.
Step 3: Cook the paste with spices, add cream and veggies.
Step 4: Simmer till it’s rich and luxurious. Serve with naan or rice.
